content.heading: HTML Images
paragraphs: Images can improve the design and appearance of a web page.

content.heading: HTML Images Syntax
paragraphs: The HTML tag is used to embed an image in a web page. Images are linked to web pages, and the tag creates a holding space for the referenced image.

content.heading: Example
The src Attribute
paragraphs: The required src attribute specifies the path (URL) to the image. If the browser cannot find the image, it will display a broken link icon and the alt text.

content.heading: Example
The alt Attribute
paragraphs: The required alt attribute provides an alternate text for an image if the user cannot view it. The value of the alt attribute should describe the image.

content.heading: Example
Image Size - Width and Height
paragraphs: You can use the style attribute to specify the width and height of an image.

content.heading: Example
Example
Width and Height, or Style?
paragraphs: The width, height, and style attributes are valid in HTML, but it's suggested to use the style attribute to prevent stylesheets from changing the size of images.

content.heading: Example
Images in Another Folder
paragraphs: If you have your images in a sub-folder, you must include the folder name in the src attribute.

content.heading: Example
Images on Another Server/Website
paragraphs: To point to an image on another server, specify an absolute (full) URL in the src attribute.

content.heading: Example
Animated Images
paragraphs: HTML allows animated GIFs.

content.heading: Example
Image as a Link
paragraphs: To use an image as a link, put the tag inside the tag.

content.heading: Example
Image Floating
paragraphs: Use the CSS float property to let the image float to the right or left of text.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
The image will float to the right of the text.

The image will float to the left of the text.
